title: Poland: Kronenberg Foundation Honored for Building Social Capital for Women
summary: Warsaw, Poland - "Financial Independence for Women," a program of the Kronenberg Foundation at Citi Handlowy and the Women's Rights Centre, was among the 10 best practices honored in the competition "Together We Are Building Social Capital." The competition is part of a project being carried out by the Polish Confederation of Private Employers Lewiatan and Deloitte as a platform for collaboration between the NGO sector and business.
tag-1: Poland: Kronenberg Foundation Honored for Building Social Capital for Women
tag-2: Warsaw, Poland – "Financial Independence for Women," a program of the Kronenberg Foundation at Citi Handlowy and the Women's Rights Centre, was among the 10 best practices honored in the competition "Together We Are Building Social Capital." The competition is part of a project being carried out by the Polish Confederation of Private Employers Lewiatan and Deloitte as a platform for collaboration between the NGO sector and business.
tag-3: "The fact that one of our practices was among the 10 laureates of this competition is for us a signal that we are going in the right direction," says Krzysztof Kaczmar, President of the Kronenberg Foundation at Citi Handlowy. "Our program, 'Financial Independence for Women,' honored in the competition is important mainly for its strategic goal: to criminalize economic violence and to introduce this concept into the Polish Criminal Code."
tag-4: Besides the 10 best practices, 26 other projects were also honored, including as many as six coordinated by the Kronenberg Foundation at Citi Handlowy. The organizer of the competition is the Duende Foundation.
tag-5: "Financial Independence for Women" is a program that has been jointly run by the Kronenberg Foundation and the Women's Rights Centre since 2011. It supports victims of economic violence and aims to increase their chances of getting out of abusive relationships.
tag-6: A pilot version of the program was conducted in 2011-2012. During this pilot run, women who notified the Women's Rights Centre were given psychological and legal assistance, and were also given access to workshops on financial education. Three hundred women took part in the coaching sessions and in financial and social consultations. A special website was launched devoted to the issue of economic violence: http://www.finanse.cpk.org.pl/. The site has tools such as easy-to-use calculators enabling women to manage a household budget and current expenditures, an online reading room (allowing use of materials without the need to download them and leave traces on the computer), a modern FAQ database, online counseling, as well as numerous thematic polls and surveys. In September 2012 the Foundation decided to continue the program and launched the first edition.

tag-9: Bank Handlowy w Warszawie S.A. is one of the major financial institutions in Poland offering under the Citi Handlowy brand a broad range of state-of-the-art corporate, investment and consumer banking products. Through its modern distribution channels and a network of 88 branches, Bank Handlowy provides services to 20,000 corporate customers and 869,000 retail customers. The Bank's capital group includes Dom Maklerski Banku Handlowego (brokerage house) and Handlowy Leasing. Being a member of Citi, the world's largest financial institution, enables the customers of Bank Handlowy access to financial services provided in over 100 countries all over the world.

tag-11: Since its establishment in 1996 the Kronenberg Foundation has supported its founder, Citi Handlowy, in pursuing its community mission in such areas as education, support to local communities and preservation of cultural heritage. Its projects include, among others, My Finances – a financial education program for secondary school students, organized in cooperation with the National Bank of Poland and the Junior Achievement Foundation; Employee Volunteering Program (developed to encourage community involvement among the employees of Citi Handlowy), competitions: Microentrepreneur of the Year and Competition for Bank Handlowy Award for Special Achievements in the Theory of Economics and Finance, as well as the Aleksander Gieysztor Award for outstanding achievements in the preservation of Polish cultural heritage.
